meanings.definition: A situation in which the actual cost of a project exceeds the estimated cost.
meanings.sent1: The construction company faced financial challenges due to underruns in the building project.
meanings.sent2: The underruns in the budget caused delays in completing the construction.
meanings.sent3: The accountant found humor in the underruns when presenting the final project cost.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected underruns in expenses left the project manager scrambling for solutions.
meanings.sent5: The underruns in the budget were like hidden obstacles on the path to project completion.

meanings.definition: A condition in which a computer program runs out of memory or processing capacity.
meanings.sent1: The game crashed due to underruns in memory allocation.
meanings.sent2: Underruns in processing power can lead to slow performance of the software.
meanings.sent3: The underruns in memory made the computer act like it had amnesia.
meanings.sent4: The sudden underruns in processing capacity paralyzed the computer system.
meanings.sent5: The underruns in memory were like roadblocks hindering the program's execution.

meanings.definition: A flaw in a printing process where the ink does not fully cover the paper.
meanings.sent1: The underruns in printing resulted in faded images on the brochure.
meanings.sent2: The underruns caused the text to appear incomplete on the flyer.
meanings.sent3: The underruns in ink coverage made the poster look like a modern art piece.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected underruns in printing quality affected the final product's appearance.
meanings.sent5: The underruns in ink coverage created a unique, abstract design on the packaging.
